isis.stitle: ELECTRONIC ENGINE CONTROLS - CUMMINS PT PACER - 1992 - 1993 - TROUBLESHOOTING

svcsubsecinfo.para: This section provides troubleshooting procedures only for the Ignition feed circuit. The PT Pacer does not have any controls or lamps on the instrument panel. All service for the PT Pacer Unit must be performed using off-board electronic service tools (see SERVICE TOOLS). Circuit diagrams and component locations of the installation are included in this section.
Consult the Cummins PT Pacer System Installation Manual or the Cummins Troubleshooting and Repair Manual for proper troubleshooting procedures, specifications and fault code descriptions.

svcproc.title: TESTING IGNITION FEED WITHOUT KYSOR ENGINE SHUTDOWN

note.para: With Kysor Shutdown, refer to appropriate Electrical Troubleshooting Manual.

step1.para: With key ON, measure voltage to ground at circuit 19 connection to the fuel shutoff solenoid.

step2.para: If battery voltage is present, the ignition feed is operating properly.
If battery voltage is not present, go to step 2.
If the fuse is , find the cause of the overload and correct it. Replace 10 amp F4 fuse.
If fuse is OK, find the open in feed circuit 13A/19 and correct.
